front.p: unknown date: Octavius Hadfield to unknown person

body.p: people." untill In His appointed time we are admitted into His eternal rest. I daily remember you in my prayers oh may the Lord direct you + dispose of you as shall be most to His glory. - I will give you no advice trusting that you are living in sweet communion with your Heavenly Councillor who will surely direct you in all your ways. + supply you every want out of those rich treasures that are up in Him. I do not I with shame live in such close + sweet communion with my God as I once did. living as I do alone among the heathen + meeting with many interruptions when endeavouring to enjoy (?) occasional seasons of retirement, I feel apt to wish for a release but not so much for the sake of being with "Christ who is far better" but for the sake of , - I feel as tho' I should like to live in retirement separate from the world + spend the rest of my life in Prayer + study of the word of God.
